entries.title: Twitter Rolls Out Blue Checkmarks for Paying Customers
entries.description: Twitter Inc. said it has begun rolling out software updates to charge users $7.99 a month to mark their accounts with a blue checkmark, part of Elon Musk’s early efforts to boost revenue a little more than a week after taking ownership of the social-media network.

entries.title: First Week of Elon Musk's Twitter Was Chaos and Confusion for Employees
entries.description: Inside Twitter Inc. in the week after Elon Musk took it over, almost no one seemed to know for sure what was going on.

entries.title: How the Chips Act Could Benefit Tech Stocks and Investors
entries.description: Semiconductors and other tech stocks have taken a beating. Is it time for a second look?

entries.title: E-Bikes and the Urban Commute
entries.description: Taco Carlier and his brother launched VanMoof to sell electronic bikes to city dwellers. Why he thinks light electric vehicles are the future of mass transit.

entries.title: What Happened When One School Took Smartphones Away From the Kids
entries.description: Nearly two months after the ban, students are getting used to life without social media and the drama of group texts—even if not all of them love it.

entries.title: Bitcoin-Mining Machines: For Sale on Deep Discount
entries.description: Some mining companies’ expenses, especially their debt payments, have overwhelmed their revenue, forcing them to sell hardware to raise cash.

entries.title: Crypto Firms, Executives Step Up Campaign Donations, Lobbying Ahead of Midterms
entries.description: The industry is seeking influence in Washington as regulators increase their scrutiny of digital assets.

entries.title: Why Elon Musk's Quest to Revive Twitter Is Likely to Fail
entries.description: Musk’s strategy at Twitter might work at a startup, but Twitter is a mature company in an extremely competitive market, with little prospects for growth.
